Key Match Events: Gleyber Torres drove in Anthony Volpe to give the Yankees a 7–6 lead.
Alex Verdugo hit a weak grounder to shortstop that Cleveland Guardians shortstop Brayan Rocchio couldn’t field cleanly, allowing Jon Berti to score the go-ahead run.
Anthony Rizzo and Aaron Judge hit home runs for the Yankees in the top of the first and second innings.
Jhonkensy Noel drew a one-out walk, followed by a single to right field by Andres Gimenez, bringing the game-winning run to the plate.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees can clinch the AL pennant and a trip to the World Series with a win on Saturday.
Cleveland Guardians closer Emmanuel Clase struggled in the ninth inning, giving up consecutive singles to Rizzo and Volpe.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Juan Soto walked, and Aaron Judge singled to begin the sixth inning, setting up a three-run homer by Giancarlo Stanton.
